Description:
Fail to switch 123.45 to boolean value in dataset.
Build number:2.3.0.v20071120

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open attached report.
2. Edit the script dataset, click Preview Result.

Expected result:
Display data rows.

Actual result:
Error dialog to indicate that fail to convert value to boolean.

In Boolean java doc, I saw "representing the value true if the string argument is not null and is equal, ignoring case, to the string "true"".
So I think it should accept any kind of string values.



Error log:

For all non-zero number values should return true otherwise return false, when we convert it to boolean.

We?ll accept any Number format data including both ?Integer? and ?Double? type when evaluating it to Boolean follow the rule: if its value equals to 0 return Boolean.False, else return Boolean.True.

So this bug is fixed.
